title: Introduction to babelgene
text: Genomic analysis model organisms frequently requires use databases based human data making comparisons patient-derived resources. requires harmonization gene names gene space. babelgene R package helps simplify conversion process. provides gene orthologs/homologs: multiple frequently studied model organisms, mouse, rat, fly, zebrafish sourced multiple databases gene symbols, NCBI Entrez, Ensembl IDs without accessing external resources requiring active internet connection R-friendly “tidy” format one gene pair per row

title: Introduction to babelgene
text: can install babelgene R package CRAN. Load babelgene. main functionality accessed via orthologs() function takes one genes outputs data frame predicted ortholog/homolog pairs. output data frame contains gene symbols IDs human specified species. Several examples provided . Get mouse equivalents set human genes. Input genes assumed human default. can specify input genes human human parameter. possible search NCBI Entrez Ensembl IDs instead gene symbols. orthologs() function requires species parameter set (scientific common names acceptable). can check species can queried help species() function.
code: install.packages("babelgene") library(babelgene) orthologs(genes = c("TP53", "EGFR", "IL6", "TGFB1", "CD4"), species = "mouse") #>   human_symbol human_entrez   human_ensembl taxon_id symbol entrez #> 1          CD4          920 ENSG00000010610    10090    Cd4  12504 #> 2         EGFR         1956 ENSG00000146648    10090   Egfr  13649 #> 3          IL6         3569 ENSG00000136244    10090    Il6  16193 #> 4        TGFB1         7040 ENSG00000105329    10090  Tgfb1  21803 #> 5         TP53         7157 ENSG00000141510    10090  Trp53  22059 #>              ensembl #> 1 ENSMUSG00000023274 #> 2 ENSMUSG00000020122 #> 3 ENSMUSG00000025746 #> 4 ENSMUSG00000002603 #> 5 ENSMUSG00000059552 #> EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #> 3                Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #> 4 EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #> 5 EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #>   support_n #> 1        12 #> 2        12 #> 3        10 #> 4        12 #> 5        12 orthologs(genes = "Pu", species = "fruit fly", human = FALSE) #>   human_symbol human_entrez   human_ensembl taxon_id symbol entrez     ensembl #> 1         GCH1         2643 ENSG00000131979     7227     Pu  37415 FBgn0003162 #> title: Introduction to babelgene
text: package based data provided Human Genome Organization (HUGO) Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) European Bioinformatics Institute. HGNC Comparison Orthology Predictions (HCOP) integrates orthology assertions predicted human genes eggNOG, Ensembl Compara, HGNC, HomoloGene, Inparanoid, NCBI Gene Orthology, OMA, OrthoDB, OrthoMCL, Panther, PhylomeDB, TreeFam ZFIN. name babelgene derived Babel Fish, fictional species fish translate humans.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dolgalev (2022). babelgene: Gene Orthologs Model Organisms Tidy Data Format. R package version 22.3.9001, https://igordot.github.io/babelgene/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {babelgene: Gene Orthologs for Model Organisms in a Tidy Data Format},   author = {Igor Dolgalev},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 22.3.9001},   url = {https://igordot.github.io/babelgene/}, }

what: Gene Orthologs for Model Organisms in a Tidy Data Format
title: Gene Orthologs for Model Organisms in a Tidy Data Format
text: Genomic analysis model organisms frequently requires use databases based human data making comparisons patient-derived resources. requires harmonization gene names gene space. babelgene R package helps simplify conversion process. provides gene orthologs/homologs: multiple frequently studied model organisms, mouse, rat, fly, zebrafish sourced multiple databases gene symbols, NCBI Entrez, Ensembl IDs without accessing external resources requiring active internet connection R-friendly “tidy” format one gene pair per row Check documentation website information.

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
text: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs set genes. Converts human non-human analogs.

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
code: orthologs(genes, species, human = TRUE, min_support = 3, top = TRUE)

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
text: genes vector gene symbols Entrez/Ensembl IDs. species Species name, Mus musculus mouse (see species() options). human logical scalar indicating input genes human. TRUE, input genes human. FALSE, input genes correspond non-human species output human equivalents. min_support Minimum number supporting source databases. top gene, output match highest support level multiple hits.

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
text: data frame gene pairs (human given species).

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
text: Wright MW, Eyre TA, Lush MJ, Povey S, Bruford EA. HCOP: HGNC comparison orthology predictions search tool. Mamm Genome. 2005 Nov;16(11):827-8. doi:10.1007/s00335-005-0103-2 Eyre TA, Wright MW, Lush MJ, Bruford EA. HCOP: searchable database human orthology predictions. Brief Bioinform. 2007 Jan;8(1):2-5. doi:10.1093/bib/bbl030 Seal RL, Gordon SM, Lush MJ, Wright MW, Bruford EA. genenames.org: HGNC resources 2011. Nucleic Acids Res. 2011 Jan;39:D514-9. doi:10.1093/nar/gkq892

title: Retrieve gene orthologs/homologs — orthologs
code: orthologs(genes = "TP53", species = "mouse", human = TRUE) #>   human_symbol human_entrez   human_ensembl taxon_id symbol entrez #> 1         TP53         7157 ENSG00000141510    10090  Trp53  22059 #>              ensembl #> 1 ENSMUSG00000059552 #>                                                                                         support #> 1 EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #>   support_n #> 1        12 orthologs(genes = c("Ptprc", "Cd34"), species = "mouse", human = FALSE) #>   human_symbol human_entrez   human_ensembl taxon_id symbol entrez #> 1         CD34          947 ENSG00000174059    10090   Cd34  12490 #> 2        PTPRC         5788 ENSG00000081237    10090  Ptprc  19264 #>              ensembl #> 1 ENSMUSG00000016494 #> 2 ENSMUSG00000026395 #>                                                                                         support #> 1 EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther|PhylomeDB|Treefam #> 2                   EggNOG|Ensembl|HGNC|HomoloGene|Inparanoid|NCBI|OMA|OrthoDB|OrthoMCL|Panther #>   support_n #> 1        12 #> 2        10

title: Retrieve the available species — species
text: species Species name, Mus musculus mouse. specified, return results given species .

title: babelgene (development version)
text: Updated database. Added check NAs input genes (#3).

title: babelgene 22.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-30 Updated database. Fixed minimum support filter.
